entities.name: harry potter
entities.description: The main character in the story, mentioned as 'Harry Potter' and also referred to by his first name 'Harry'. The text describes him trying to squash a Mandrake into a pot and struggling with Transfiguration. (Excerpt: 'Harry spent ten whole minutes trying to squash a particularly fat one into a pot.')

entities.name: mandrakes
entities.description: A type of magical plant that is difficult to handle. The text describes them as squirming, kicking, and flailing their fists. (Excerpt: 'The Mandrakes didn’t like coming out of the earth, but didn’t seem to want to go back into it either.')

entities.name: professor sprout
entities.description: A professor who teaches Herbology. The text describes her as making something look 'extremely easy' but actually being difficult. (Excerpt: 'Professor Sprout had made it look extremely easy, but it wasn’t.')

entities.name: professor mcgonagall
entities.description: A professor who teaches Transfiguration. The text describes her classes as 'hard work' and mentions that Harry struggled with the lesson. (Excerpt: 'Professor McGonagall’s classes were always hard work, but today was especially difficult.')

entities.name: gryffindors
entities.description: A group of students who attend Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry. The text mentions that the Gryffindors 'hurried off to Transfiguration'. (Excerpt: 'They traipsed back to the castle for a quick wash and then the Gryffindors hurried off to Transfiguration.')

entities.name: beetle
entities.description: A type of insect that is being used in Professor McGonagall's lesson. The text describes Harry struggling to turn it into a button. (Excerpt: 'He was supposed to be turning a beetle into a button, but all he')

entities.name: hogwarts
entities.description: A school of witchcraft and wizardry where Harry attends classes. The text mentions that the students traipsed back to the castle for a wash. (Excerpt: 'They traipsed back to the castle for a quick wash')
